intro: Gutierrezia triflora, commonly known as sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and open grasslands. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia triflora is also known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
